Ingest_LDD.name: Display
Ingest_LDD.comment:
The PDS4 Display namespace is used to define how an array-type object with two or more dimensions should be displayed on, for example, computer monitor or video screen.
samples l ----------------- band 1 i / ************** / n / ************** / -- band 2 e / ************** / ~ / s / ************** / ~ / -- band 3 / ************** / ~ / # / ------------------ ~ / # / / ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ / # / / ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ / # / ------------------ # / / ############## / / ############## / ------------------
Figure showing the layout of a typical band sequential image. Often there may only be one band in an image or many more than 3 bands. For many images, a band defines a single wavelength or range of wavelengths (of energy) as measured by an instrument or sensor. But a band can also hold a wide variety of measurements or caluclated derived values, for example, the phase or emission angle for each pixel in the image or each pixel can represent a topopgraphic elevation (also called digital elevation model, DEM or DTM). Setting band 1, 2, and 3 respectively (or really any mixture of bands) to the red, blue, and green (RGB) channels of a display will result in a color composite image.
for changes in this file, please see the CHANGELOG.md on GitHub https://github.com/pds-data-dictionaries/ldd-disp

DD_Attribute.name: horizontal_display_axis
DD_Attribute.definition: The horizontal_display_axis attribute identifies, by name, the axis of an Array (or Array subclass) that is intended to be displayed in the horizontal or "sample" dimension on a display device. The value of this attribute must match the value of one, and only one, axis_name attribute in an Axis_Array class of the associated Array.

DD_Attribute.name: horizontal_display_direction
DD_Attribute.definition: The horizontal_display_direction attribute specifies the direction across the screen of a display device that data along the horizontal axis of an Array is supposed to be displayed.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The lowest indexed element along an array axis should be displayed at the left edge of a display device and elements with higher indices should be displayed further to the right. Note that this is the standard display direction for most image formats.

The lowest indexed element along an array axis should be displayed at the right edge of a display device and elements with higher indices should be displayed further to the left. Note that virtually no image display formats use this display direction. Use this only when deliberately mirroring the image around the vertical axis.

DD_Attribute.name: vertical_display_axis
DD_Attribute.definition: The vertical_display_axis attribute identifies, by name, the axis of an Array (or Array subclass) that is intended to be displayed in the vertical or "line" dimension on a display device. The value of this attribute must match the value of one, and only one, axis_name attribute in an Axis_Array class of the associated Array.

DD_Attribute.name: vertical_display_direction
DD_Attribute.definition: The vertical_display_direction attribute specifies the direction along the screen of a display device that data along the vertical axis of an Array is supposed to be displayed.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The lowest indexed element along an array axis should be displayed at the top edge of a display device and elements with higher indices should be displayed lower down. This is the display direction typically used for VICAR, ISIS, or TIFF formatted data.

The lowest indexed element along an array axis should be displayed at the bottom edge of a display device and elements with higher indices should be displayed higher up. This is the display direction typically used for FITS formatted data.

DD_Attribute.name: color_display_axis
DD_Attribute.definition: The color_display_axis attribute identifies, by name, the axis of an Array (or Array subclass) that is intended to be displayed in the color dimension of a display device. The value of this attribute must match the value of one, and only one, axis_name attribute in an Axis_Array class of the associated Array. For many uses, the band axis will be defined here and will ultimately load three seperate bands into the red, green, and blue channels of the display device (also known as a color composite).

DD_Attribute.name: red_channel_band
DD_Attribute.definition: The red_channel_band attribute identifies the number of the band, along the band axis, that should be loaded, by default, into the red channel of a display device. The first band along the band axis has band number 1.

DD_Attribute.name: green_channel_band
DD_Attribute.definition: The green_channel_band attribute identifies the number of the band, along the band axis, that should be loaded, by default, into the green channel of a display device. The first band along the band axis has band number 1.

DD_Attribute.name: blue_channel_band
DD_Attribute.definition: The blue_channel_band attribute identifies the number of the band, along the band axis, that should be loaded, by default, into the blue channel of a display device. The first band along the band axis has band number 1.

DD_Attribute.name: time_display_axis
DD_Attribute.definition: The time_display_axis attribute identifies, by name, the axis of an Array (or Array subclass), generally bands, of which are intended to be displayed sequentially in time on a display device. The frame_rate attribute, if present, provides the rate at which these frames (e.g., bands) are to be displayed.

DD_Attribute.name: frame_rate
DD_Attribute.definition: The frame_rate attribute indicates the number of still pictures (or frames) that should be displayed per unit of time in a video. Here we define the unit of time being frames per second (fps). Note this is NOT necessarily the same as the rate at which the images were acquired. Only positive values are legal. For context, video is primarily distributed in 24fps and 30fps frame rates.

DD_Attribute.name: loop_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: The loop_flag attribute specifies whether or not a movie object should be played repeatedly without prompting from the user.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: The movie should be "looped" or played repeatedly.
The movie should be not be "looped" or played repeatedly.

DD_Attribute.name: loop_count
DD_Attribute.definition: The loop_count attribute specifies the number of times a movie should be "looped" or replayed before stopping. A loop_count of zero is allowed and defines an infinite loop, meaning the animation or movie should never stop looping.

DD_Attribute.name: loop_delay
DD_Attribute.definition: The loop_delay attribute specifies the amount of time to pause between "loops" or repeated playbacks of an animation or movie.

DD_Attribute.name: loop_back_and_forth_flag
DD_Attribute.definition: The loop_back_and_forth_flag attribute specifies whether or not a movie should only be "looped" or played repeatedly in the forward direction, or whether it should be played forward followed by played in reverse, iteratively.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: When looping, the movie should be played in the forward direction, followed by the reverse direction, iteratively.
When looping, the movie should only be played in the forward direction. This is the default behavior.

DD_Class.name: Display_Settings
DD_Class.definition: The Display_Settings class contains one or more classes describing how data should be displayed on a display device (e.g., computer monitor).

DD_Class.name: Display_Direction
DD_Class.definition: The Display_Direction class specifies how two of the dimensions of an Array object should be displayed in the vertical (line) and horizontal (sample) dimensions of a display device.

DD_Class.name: Color_Display_Settings
DD_Class.definition: The Color_Display_Settings class provides guidance to data users on how to display a multi-banded Array object on a color-capable display device using red, blue and green (RGB) channels. For most images, a band defines a single or a range of wavelengths (of energy), as measured by an instrument or sensor.

DD_Class.name: Movie_Display_Settings
DD_Class.definition: The Movie_Display_Settings class provides default values for the display of a multi-banded Array using a software application capable of displaying and animnation or video content.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: In disp:Display_Settings, the value of the pds:local_identifier_reference (<sch:value-of select='pds:local_identifier_reference'/>) must match the value of the pds:local_identifer of an Array class or sub-class within the File_Area.
In disp:Display_Settings, the value of pds:local_reference_type (<sch:value-of select='pds:local_reference_type'/>) must equal 'display_settings_to_array'.

In Display_Direction, the horizontal_display_axis (<sch:value-of select='$horizontal_display_axis'/>) must match the name of an axis in the referenced Array (<sch:value-of select='$local_identifier_reference'/>)

In Display_Direction, the vertical_display_axis (<sch:value-of select='$vertical_display_axis'/>) must match the name of an axis in the referenced Array (<sch:value-of select='$local_identifier_reference'/>)

In Display_Direction, the horizontal_display_axis (<sch:value-of select='$horizontal_display_axis'/>) must not match the name of the vertical_display_axis in the referenced Array (<sch:value-of select='$local_identifier_reference'/>)

In Color_Display_Settings, the color_display_axis (<sch:value-of select='$color_display_axis'/>) must match the name of an axis in the referenced Array (<sch:value-of select='$local_identifier_reference'/>)

In Color_Display_Settings, the color_display_axis (<sch:value-of select='$color_display_axis'/>) must not match the name of horizontal_display_axis or vertical_display_axis in the referenced Array (<sch:value-of select='$local_identifier_reference'/>)

In Color_Display_Settings, the value of red_channel_band (<sch:value-of select="disp:red_channel_band"/>) is out of range for the length (<sch:value-of select='$bands'/>) of the color_display_axis (<sch:value-of select='$color_display_axis'/>).

In Color_Display_Settings, the value of green_channel_band (<sch:value-of select="disp:green_channel_band"/>) is out of range for the length (<sch:value-of select='$bands'/>) of the color_display_axis (<sch:value-of select='$color_display_axis'/>).

In Color_Display_Settings, the value of blue_channel_band (<sch:value-of select="disp:blue_channel_band"/>) is out of range for the length (<sch:value-of select='$bands'/>) of the color_display_axis (<sch:value-of select='$color_display_axis'/>).

In Movie_Display_Settings, the time_display_axis (<sch:value-of select='$time_display_axis'/>) must match the name of an axis in the referenced Array (<sch:value-of select='$local_identifier_reference'/>)

In Movie_Display_Settings, the time_display_axis (<sch:value-of select='$time_display_axis'/>) must not match the name of the horizontal_display_axis or vertical_display_axis in the referenced Array (<sch:value-of select='$local_identifier_reference'/>)
